Comment: I move up my centre pawns to free my queen and bishops...
I move up my centre pawns to free my queen and bishops...
I move up my centre pawns to free my queen and bishops...
...then we exchange.
...then we exchange.
Now I develop my knight...
Now I develop my knight...
...he develops his to attack my queen...
...I develop my bishop and pin the knight down...
...he brings out his bishop to unpin it...
...so I remove the knight and its threat to the queen...
...but lose my bishop...
...and castle kingside to bring my rook into play if needs be.
His queen adds pressure to my pawn on e4...
...so I contest it with my knight.
Now I move up my other bishop to attack the queen...
Now I move up my other bishop to attack the queen...
...but it must retreat.
...but it must retreat.
Now I move up my knight to attack the queen...
Now I move up my knight to attack the queen...
...but he moves her out of the way...
...so I attack the bishop...
...and he attacks my queen...
...so I accept his bishop.
Now my surviving bishop removes his far pawn...
Now my surviving bishop removes his far pawn...
...so my knight can attack the king, whilst protected from the pawn by the queen.
...so my knight can attack the king, whilst protected from the pawn by the queen.
